intro: Lysimachia cubangensis, commonly known as the Cubango yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its botanical structure includes opposite leaves and a fibrous root system, which help it adapt to its natural habitat.
